title: Manchester City to sell Ederson to Fenerbahce – if they land Donnarumma
description: Manchester City have agreed to sell Ederson to Fenerbahce for €14m – but the transfer is dependent on a deal being agreed for Gianluca Donnarumma
content:
Manchester City have agreed to sell Ederson to Fenerbahce for €14m – but the transfer is dependent on Gianluca Donnarumma arriving from Paris Saint-Germain for around €35m, or for another elite goalkeeper to be signed as the Brazilian’s replacement.

Ederson has a year left on his £8m-a-season contract with City, and has become unsettled at the club, while Donnarumma has been deemed surplus to requirements by Luis Enrique at PSG, with the Spaniard signing Lucas Chevalier last month to be first-choice at the European champions.

Ederson has been City’s No 1 since signing for £34.9m from Benfica in June 2017. He has won six Premier Leagues, two FA Cups, for League Cups, the Champions League, Uefa Super Cup and Club World Cup. The 32-year-old was a key member of City’s 2022-23 treble triumph.
summary: Manchester City has agreed to sell its goalkeeper, Ederson, for €14m, pending the arrival of Gianluca Donnarumma from Paris Saint-Germain. The transfer is dependent on the arrival and replacement of Ederson. The Brazilian has been City's No 1 since his £8m contract was signed in June 2018.
shortSummary: Manchester City plans to sell goalkeeper Ederson to Fenerbahce for €14m, contingent on Gianluca Donnarumma's arrival from Paris St.Germain.

scraped_sources.text:
Manchester City have signed Ederson from Benfica for a British record fee for a goalkeeper. The 23-year-old Brazilian joins Pep Guardiola’s side after two seasons in the Primeira Liga.
Benfica released a statement on Thursday morning say that they had reached an agreement with the Premier League club to sell the goalkeeper for €40m (£34.9m).
The goalkeeping situation was one of Guardiola’s biggest problems during his debut season in England despite the signing of Barcelona’s Claudio Bravo for £13.75m. The Chilean failed to impress and Guardiola, in the end, resorted to rotating him and Willy Caballero as City finished third in the league, 15 points behind Chelsea at the top, and were eliminated from the Champions League in the last 16 and lost an FA Cup semi-final to Arsenal.
Joe Hart spent the season on loan at Torino and the England No1 is now likely to leave the club on a permanent deal.
Ederson becomes City’s second summer signing, after the capture of the Monaco midfielder Bernardo Silva for £43.6m.
The club have sold their young Turkish striker Enes Unal for £12m to Villarreal while releasing Caballero, Gaël Clichy, Jesús Navas and Bacary Sagna, who had all reached the end of their contracts.
